div.l: Was none so hardy that wente by the way
That durst with hur rage or onys play
But yf he slayn̄ wold be of Symkyn̄
With panade knyf or Boydekyn̄
For Ieloꝰus folk ben ꝑperyloꝰus eủer mo
Algate they wold her wyues went so
And eke for sche was somdele smoterlych
Sche was as digne as water in a dyche
As full of hoker and bysmare
Hur thought that a lady schuld her spare
What for hur kynrede and hur nortrery
That sche had lerned in the non̄erye
A dought̉er had they bytwyxe hem two
Of xx yer͗e with oute mo
Savynge a child þat was of half yere of age
In cradel hit lay and was a ꝓproper page
This wenche thykke and well growen was
With Camoyse nose and yen̄ grey as glasse
With Buttokꝭes brode and brestꝭes rounde ⁊and hyȝe
But right feyre was hur her͗e y woll not lye
The person̄ of the toun̄ for sche was so fayr͗e
In purpose was to make hur his eyre
Both of his catel and his mesuage
And straunge he made hit of hur maryage
Hys purpose was for to bestowe hur hiȝe
In to som̄ worthy blod of Aunsetry
For holy churche gode most be dyspended
On holy church blod þat is descended
Therfore he wold his holy blod honoᵘur
Though þᵗat he holychurch schuld devour͗e
Grete sokyn̄ hath this myller oute of doute
With whete and malte of all the contrey aboute
And namely þ̉er was a grete Colege
Men̄ clepeth the Soler halle at Caumbrigge
Ther͗e was her whete and her malte ground
And on a day hit happed in a stound
